DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the use of Capnography (Continuous recording of the carbon dioxide content of expired air)as an alternative test to measure PC02 levels in patients with asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary (COPD,interstitial lung disease(ILD)or coronary disease who are at risk of intubation.
DOC.brief_title: Use Of Capnography As Surrogate Measure Of PC02 In Medical Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This is a prospective study to evaluate the usefulness of capnography as a non-invasive, accurate method of measuring of PC02 levels in medical intensive care unit patients with asthma, COPD, ILD, or coronary disease who are at risk of intubation.
DOC.criteria: Medical Intensive Care Patients Not intubated Age 18 or older History of any one of the following: asthma, COPD, ILD, or coronary disease Sepsis Life expectancy less than 1 month Requiring BIPAP
